text: Pink-cyclamen headless beer. Rather fade cherry nose, bit lactic. Sour cherries, art, full fruit but not explosively, held back. Astringency, lipsmacking sourness, dry-out effect, acidthinning. Decent kriek, but not really outstanding.

From bottle shared at Ratebeer Best awards and bottle-share. Ruby red color with pink head. Yeasty aroma, funky bretty, barnyard, tart fruity, cherries - berries, some grass notes, vinous, wood. Sweet and acidic taste like aroma. Light to medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Bottle acquired in trade... Brilliant reddish purple in color... Aroma of cherry candy, raspberries... Flavor is maybe a little one dimensional, lots of tart cherries, some yogurt, funk on finish... A little formic acid solvent notes on palate... pretty nice, but not my favorite cherry sour

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle: Poured a red color sour ale with a medium size foamy head. Aroma of cerise pit and tart notes is quite nice. Taste is a mix of cerise pit with some tart notes and some acidity noticeable and limited residual sugar. Body is full with good carbonation. Interesting and enjoyable beer.
Bottle at Xmas 2016 gathering. Pours pink no head or lacing. Nose is tart charries and some raspberries. Medium tart, light sweet. Light body lively carbonation. Nice!

Dangerous Bottleshares XL forealz edition. Pours hazy bright red with a tiny white head. Aroma of sweet cherry, tart lactic notes, oak, vanilla, marzipan and macaron. Taste of cherry, vanilla, macaron, oak, lactic tartness, slight vinegar and pretty jammy as well. A good one indeed!
Pours a milky pinkish colour with a pinkish head. Nose has yoghurty forrest berries and some makroner. Flavours are dry and fruity. Soft aftertaste not very strong. Kinda hard to describe.

Pour hazy light red, with as good as no head. 
Aroma of cherry, slight funk, slight grass, sugary almonds, macaroons, slightly cheesy. 
Taste is slightly acidic, with faint fruity sweet notes. 
Slightly watery body, with a fizzy carb. Thanks a bunch boys.

Bottle @ Killem All 2016. Pours hazy milky orange-ish red with a small white ish head. Aromas of macarons, marzipan, sweet cherries, light vinegar, funk, cheese, tannins. Taste has marzipan, macarons, sweet cherry candy, lactic, subtle vinegar, funk.

Bottle from trade with Matt Kennedy at Dangerous Bottleshares XL 4Realz Edition Motherbrother, Hoprider and Aaron. Pours a hazy rusty red with a small, fizzy, pink head. Aroma has insane amounts of macaroons, cherries, marzipan, cherry pits, vanilla, oak, tannic. Taste is super sour, tannic, vinous, lots of cherry, heaty tartness, leading to a juicy finish. High carbonation and a light body.

Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshares XL feat. Motherbrother, hoprider and FranzBC. Light hazy deep red pour with a small pale head. Notes of macarones, cherry, chery pits, funk, lingering tartness and some jammy notes.

On tap at Hops & Pie. Pinkish red, hazy appearance with a white head. Big, sour cherry aroma with oak, earth, barnyard funk and light vanilla. Moderately sour with a tart, puckering mouth feel. Light to medium body with a tart and sour cherry finish. Deliciously refreshing and fun to drink overall.

Un immense merci à Marc-André pour ce lambic américain! Ce verre est flamboyant! Le feu est littéralement pris dans mon verre. Un jus de cerises rouge vif qui pourrait facilement passer pour une jus de framboises. Mousse absente. Le liquide est nu devant moi et je me sens tout aussi nu devant lui tant je suis soumis à ses arômes. Un funk fabuleux de lambic, de cerise noire, de framboise, de cette culture bactérienne unique à Casey qui me chavire à chaque fois. Je mets quiconque au défi didentifier le pays dorigine de cette bière lors dune dégustation à laveugle. Une profondeur déroutante de lambic où la cerise taquine habilement le funk. Je pourrais boire de cette bière bière à linfini.

Bottle shared with Gus and others at the Unnamed Bottle Share. Aroma is cherries, wonderful, candy, tart, sour, man. Appearance is red, off white light pink head, mostly hazy. Taste is cherry, funk, sour, tart, candy, my god. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light crisp carbonation, tart cherry candy aftertaste. Overall, good lord this is wonderful.
Pours a cloudy pinkish red color with no head. Cherry pie cinnamon. Diaper. Medium mouthfeellow carbonation.

Bottle Pours hazy red with white head. Aroma is strong of cherries, desserty, lots of brett, lemon, hints of oak and vanilla, lots of wild yeast aromas. Taste is tart throughout, great cherry flavor pulling through, cranberry-like finish, funky throughout. Overall, exceptional.

Bottle @ Aarons Wedding Eve Shindig. Pinkish red pour with a light pink head. Smells mostly of cherry pie with a nice lemony note and some mild yogurt funk. A good bit of spice, some green grape skin, and oak. A light funk to the flavor along with a pretty bright acidity and tons of cherry character. Sort of a tannic fruit skin quality and a dry finish. Nice citrusy tang and zest. Good stuff.

Bottle shared at my pre-wedding bash with some other RB nerds. Pours a hazy pink appearance with a pinkish / cream colored head. The aroma is full of spicy, herbal cherries that is reminiscent of cherry crisp. Theres an interplay between cinnamon-like spiciness and pie cherries. The cool thing about this is that base beer, Oak Theory, shines through brightly with all the cobweb / basement funk / cheesy notes readily apparent and not dominated by the cherries. The cherries are complementary not overpowering. Moderately sour. Delicious and a treat.
Bottle shared by SteveO. Thanks! Pours a pinkish red color with white head. Fresh cherry, raspberry, berry aromas. Sour, cherry pie, raspberry flavors. Tasty! A little better than the blackberry.
Pink pour. White head that quickly falls. No lacing. Sour aroma, slight rubber note. Big lactic and burnt rubber note. Some sweetness. Tart finish with some sweet cherry skin flavors in the end.
Bottle at niels bash. Nose is super woody and light cherry skin. Pink pour with a small white head. Taste is similar with a moderate chest thumping sourness. Really good.

Bottle at Aarons Pre-Wedding Bash. Pour is bright pink with a big white head and sticky lacing. Big cherry pie - graham crackers, cherry skins, spice, cinnamon, funky, urine, big oaky, and fruity aroma. Taste is bright cherries, raspberry skins, biscuit, lemony, graham crackers, pie crust, and oak with a big sour finish. Medium body with high carbonation. Super delicious - but was expecting a lot more fruit out of this one.

750 ml bottle to snifter (shared with the Mrs; thanks @@ron). Bottled 3/20/15. Looks good; a cloudy bright cherry with white head that has a light pink hue to it and steadily dissipates into thin lacing. A bit of fine sediment towards the bottom of the bottle, but nothing excessive or offensive. Smells and tastes tart, oaky, and funky with a very nice cherry presence. Mouthfeel is medium-light to medium-bodied and pleasantly tart and lively. A great cherry take on the base.
wow, a cherry flavor overload, a very nice backdrop of tart and yeast flavors. Finish is all cherry pie. The cherry is strong but not sweet or fake tasting, Awesome sauce right here.

Bottle thanks to Dak. Pours a cloudy pink with small white head that lasts. The aroma is strong cherry skin, oak, funk, leather. Thin mouth, funky, cherry skin, light jam, leather, tart finish, very nice.
Hazy reddish/pink pour. Light head. Really a nice blend of cherries, funk, lactic sourness. This has more of a leathery note and funk than an overwhelming fruity sourness. Delicious
Bottle. Milky pinkish pour with a white head. Toejam bouquet. Well theres some sour cherry, funk, and old lawn clippings. Tannic skins. Kinda weird, but not bad. Average mouthfeel and body.

750 mL bottle poured into a snifter. Hazy bright red/pink body. Small white head. Cherry aroma is nice. Kinda jammy and juicy. Oak. A little musty. Taste is very similar, but has a tannic quality. Oak and strong, deep cherry flavor. Wine flavor is pretty strong in the back end. Moderate sourness. Medium body. Impressive fruit flavor that dominates everything else.
Bottle - pours opaque red. Nose is cherries, tart, sour. Taste is very sour cherry, lemons, tart and acidic.
Bottle. Pours pinkish with white head. Nose/taste of cherry, oak, funky acid, lactose acid and sour cherry - Medium body.
Poured from a 750 ml bottle at brewery. Amazing beer. Big bright cherry, funk, tart, cherry flesh, juicy cherries, soft maltiness, hint of almond, light dusty Brett. notes.
Bottle. Ruby pink with white head. Cherry, spice and cinnamon aromas. Sweet and fully tart cherries, spice, cinnamon flavors. Mouth puckerkngly awesome.

From short notes....

Nice pink pour with low white head. Nose is funky yeast and cherry pie spices and yogurty cheesy goodness. Really nice. Sour but not aggressive. Cherry pie spices, fresh sour cherries in a cheesy yogurty funk. Really nice cherry AWA

Bottle shared by ForgetFu at 3 Fonteinen. Pours light red with a pink hue. Very nice head retention, light pinkish. The nose is incredibly fruity with cuberdons, cassis and some rose petels as well. Light to medium body, fresh acidity getting smoother while warming up in the glass. Taste is funk raspberry and cherry. Impressive for such low ABV.
Bottle at Casey. Ruby red pour. Funky, barnyard, cherry nose. Very Drie Font. Tart, cherry, lemon. Full body. Amazing beer that rivals anything out of Belgium.
